abstract.p: Round up of advertising account changes (M)

block.p: * Butler, Shine & Stern, Sausalito, Calif., was named as the first agency to handle three accounts, with combined billings estimated at $34 million to $38 million. They were: MetaMarkets, South San Francisco, an online mutual fund; Vitessa, Seattle, an electronic commerce company, and Burst, San Francisco, an Internet software company. * Millennium Partners, New York, to Len Dugow & Associates, Miami and New York, to handle the introduction of condominium, hotel and mixed-use developments that are being built, branded and operated in conjunction with the Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons lodging chains. Billings were estimated at more than $10 million.

* Butler, Shine & Stern, Sausalito, Calif., was named as the first agency to handle three accounts, with combined billings estimated at $34 million to $38 million. They were: MetaMarkets, South San Francisco, an online mutual fund; Vitessa, Seattle, an electronic commerce company, and Burst, San Francisco, an Internet software company. * Millennium Partners, New York, to Len Dugow & Associates, Miami and New York, to handle the introduction of condominium, hotel and mixed-use developments that are being built, branded and operated in conjunction with the Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons lodging chains. Billings were estimated at more than $10 million.

* Earthnoise.com, New York, an online video community, named three agencies to handle its first account, with billings estimated at $10 million. They were: Mad Dogs and Englishmen, New York, for a print and broadcast media campaign; IN2, New York, for brand initiatives; and Alpha Dog Promotions, New York, for promotions. * AD&P, Minneapolis, to Korey Kay & Partners, New York, to handle the introduction of the Outernet, a retail chain that will offer compact discs customized with music, games and other entertainment and educational software. Initial spending is estimated at $7 million to $10 million. * AllOutdoors.com, Traverse City, Mich., an online community for outdoor enthusiasts, to Campbell-Ewald, Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its first account. Spending was estimated at $6 million.
